Comment:
I usually respond less confrontationally to e4. But this time I went with e5 because I was a bit stressed and couldn't think of anything more inventive.
So, I didn't know how to respond to this.

This effectivly wastes a move. Wouldn't Qa4 have at least left him with a developed piece? Again I don't know for sure but this gives me even more initiative.
Let's try and rule in the center. Use my initiative to usurp important squares.
Some increased hold on the center but primaly creates an outlet for my bishop.
Some increased hold on the center but primaly creates an outlet for my bishop.

And he promptly pins my other knight. In my experience this type of pin often results in the eventual exchange of bishop vs knight. this game looks fairly open so I'm thinking those exchanges would benefit me. leaving me with the bisop pair in an open game. Lets try to expidite the exchanges.
Frees my knight and announces O-O. Now my knight is sort of threatening his pawn on e4.
One trade down. One to go.
One trade down. One to go.
I feel this move is a mistake. He protects his b-pawn but he blocks his knight out from c3. I think Nc3 is better.
develop the bishop and strengthen my chokehold on the center.

I feel happy with this position. It might be crap but I think I'm pretty solid here. My bishops feels rather strong. 12. f4 could be troublesome. But I think it could be handled.
